greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The Jacob's Ladder sequence: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} (-1)^pi(k), where pi = A000720.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (First 1000 terms from Harry J. Smith.)
Theophilus Agama, The prime index function, arXiv:1905.03112 [math.GM], 2019.

Alberto Fraile, Roberto Martínez, and Daniel Fernández, Jacob's Ladder: Prime numbers in 2d, arXiv preprint arXiv:1801.01540 [math.HO], 2017. Also Prime Numbers in 2D, Math. Comput. Appl. 2020, 25, 5; https://www.mdpi.com/2297-8747/25/1/5 [They describe essentially this sequence except with offset 1 instead of 0 - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 20 2018]
Hans Havermann, Graph of first 30 million terms. [As can seen from A064940, one has to go out beyond 44 million terms to see any further runs of positive terms.]
maple: with(numtheory): f:=n->add((-1)^pi(k),k=1..n); [seq(f(n),n=0..60)]; # _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 20 2018
mathematica: a[0] = 0; a[n_] := a[n] = a[n - 1] + (-1)^PrimePi[n]; Array[a, 105, 0] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 20 2018 *)
program: (PARI) { a=0; for (n=1, 1000, a+=(-1)^primepi(n); write("b065358.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 30 2009
xref: Cf. A000720, A065357, A064940 (the zero terms).
results.author: _Jason Earls_, Oct 31 2001
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 20 2018 (added initial term a(0)=0, added name suggested by the Fraile et al. paper)
